resources.string: Blasting is the process of treating a surface by propelling particles at high velocity toward it. It is a quick and easy way to remove foreign matter from metal, rubber or plastic. Blasting is generally performed in enclosed environments like blasting chambers or cabinets, or on open sites, for example on buildings, bridges, tanks, boats or mobile plants. Common hazards include dust, hazardous chemicals, and risks associated with the use of plant and equipment. \n Blasting has many variants, including:
Lifting and shifting materials for blasting

It is a machine for cleaning structure steel. It strongly blasts the original condition steel parts to remove surface rust, welding slag, and scale, making it show uniform metal color and improve coating quality and corrosion prevention effect
Keep lifting path clear of obstruction
Ensure lifting appliance are certified to use
Follow forklift operation manual and use qualified driver
Ensure nobody is under the load
Use qualified lifters and operator for overhead crane
Flying steel shorts and metal debris
Ensure use of PPE (eg. Ear plug, googles etc)
Ensure machine protection are in good condition
Ensure exhaust fan and dust collector are working properly
Injury caused by high pressure fluid
Ensure all spray hoses and joints are properly tighten and in good condition
Ensure spray hoses have no kinks
Spray pump to standby all the time during operation and ready to shut off during emergency
Sprayer and pump man and helper to wear proper PPE
Ensure ventilation is running during painting
Worker not suitable for the job
Hotwork to be kept clear of flammable and combustible

Abrasive blasting is the operation of forcibly propelling a stream of abrasive material against a surface under high pressure to smooth a rough surface, roughen a smooth surface, shape a surface or remove surface contaminants.
Set up blasting hoses and blasting pots
Connection of working light and signal switches
Cleaning of all grits/steel shots and dusts for blasting inspection
Using defective blasting pots and air hoses
`Ensure that hoses are arrange in proper manner
Insert wires or safety pins between couplers
Check all blasting and air hose for visible defects
Qualified electrician to check working light and signal switches before use
Use only 110DC power supply in confined
Observe safe work pratice for working at height
Examine compressors, blasting nozzles , pots and vaccum equipent regularly
Blaster rotation to limit exposure duration
Avoid compressed air blow down collection to containers
Re-use of collected material or proper disposal
*Clean up work area after end of work
Maintain good housekeeping to minimize risk of exposure
Use blasting hood with air supplied

Hydro blasting is a technique for cleaning internal and external surfaces, which relies entirely on the sheer force of water from a pressurized source to achieve the desired 18 cleaning effect on the intended surface.
Entry in confined space for setting up of hoses and equipment
Setting up of the hydro blasting machine and hose / equipment
Loud noise from the hydro blasting operation
Struck by high pressure water jet
Struck by high pressure water jet due to swinging of the hoses
observe safe working pratice for working at height
ensure thatscaffold used is validated if required to use
ear plug to be worn during hydro blasting
use face shield and all other necessary PPE
do not expose body limbs/ parts to the high pressure jet during blasting
blaster to use quick release catch
ensure more than adequate length of hose is pull in the working area
Body ache due to shoveling of rubbish such as paint flakes, rust, scales
ensure that water is pump out before attempting to carry out cleaning
use proper body posture when handling shovel
ensure that hose/cable and equipment is not placed obstructing passageaway
